column4: how do I get the password to an account on my system. I have root access
if services automatically run under that account, will I have to make any serious changes to get it going?
that was vague. mysql runs under mysql user account. can't for the life of me remember the password to login as mysql.
just: passwd mysql   and change it to something else. it's different than the login password to within mysql anyway, so it shouldn't hurt a thing
when I su into another account, it appears to succeed, but my prompt stays the same, and whoami shows my original user. What could be the problem?
how are you using su? just: su user?
yes. it prompts for password, I provide.
also, remember that a user whos shell is set to /bin/false cannot attain a shell.
finger user  <-- shows you the shell
which is a good thing :) you can, of coure, change it for the time being to get stuff done.
and does it make sense to you that it also isn't listed under system > administration > users and groups?
in a case such as this, no. this is what the commandline is useful for.
that is, it doesn't surprise me
